definition[0]: to praise someone a lot or behave with a lot of respect towards them because you think that they are important and will be able to help you in some way â€“ used to show disapproval
example[0]: I had to really grovel to the bank manager to get a loan.
definition[1]: to move along the ground on your hands and knees
example[1]: I saw him grovelling in the road for his hat.
